source.name: Cooperative Weather Observations
source.description: NOAA's Cooperative Weather Observer Network is the nation's largest weather network. It was established under the Organic Act of 1890 to formalize the collection of meteorological observations and establish/record climate conditions in the United States, primarily for agricultural purposes.  Today, more than 11,000 Cooperative Weather Observers across the United States collect daily hydrometeorological data, including temperature, precipitation, snowfall, snow depth,  river gauge, and weather.
